Class Leaderboard

java.lang.Object
Leaderboard
public class Leaderboard
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the leaderboard. It defines what's on the leaderboard and how the leaderboard looks like.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Leaderboard()
    Constructor that creates the scores, the listeners, and calls the essential functions.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void draw​(javafx.scene.Group root, int windowsSize)
    Draws the leaderboard on the screen using the root and the windowSize
    void loadLeaderboard()
    Loads the leaderboard from a .ser file.
    void registerGameMenuListener​(GameStatusListener gsl)
    Adds the parameter to the gameMenuListeners
    void resetLeaderboard()
    It resets the scores on the leaderboard to 0,"X".
    void saveLeaderboard​(boolean saved, int newScore, java.lang.String difficulty)
    Updates the scores, then saves the data to a .ser file.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Leaderboard

      public Leaderboard()
      Constructor that creates the scores, the listeners, and calls the essential functions.

  • Method Details

    • loadLeaderboard

      public void loadLeaderboard()
      Loads the leaderboard from a .ser file.

    • saveLeaderboard

      public void saveLeaderboard​(boolean saved, int newScore, java.lang.String difficulty)
      Updates the scores, then saves the data to a .ser file.
      Parameters:
      saved - we don't want to save more than once.
      newScore - this is the current score that might appear on the leaderboard.
      difficulty - the current difficulty that might appear on the leaderboard.

    • resetLeaderboard

      public void resetLeaderboard()
      It resets the scores on the leaderboard to 0,"X".

    • draw

      public void draw​(javafx.scene.Group root, int windowsSize)
      Draws the leaderboard on the screen using the root and the windowSize
      Parameters:
      root - the group where we'll add the leaderboard
      windowsSize - the current size of the window

    • registerGameMenuListener

      public void registerGameMenuListener​(GameStatusListener gsl)
      Adds the parameter to the gameMenuListeners
      Parameters:
      gsl - this is the GameStatusListener that we want to add to the listeners
